pullrequest.title: add || true to docker clean statements in case there are no running containers or images

pull_request.title: add || true to docker clean statements in case there are no running containers or images

update.description:
optimus was low on disk space today, but the fix in pull request #533 wasn't working because `docker ps -q` was empty. adding `|| true` lets these commands proceed.

~~~
+++ echo 'Space left is low again: 91% used'
Space left is low again: 91% used
+++ echo 'Kill the whole docker cache !!'
Kill the whole docker cache !!
++++ sudo docker ps -q
+++ sudo docker kill
"docker kill" requires at least 1 argument.
See 'docker kill --help'.

Usage:  docker kill [OPTIONS] CONTAINER [CONTAINER...] [flags]

Kill one or more running containers
Build step 'Execute shell' marked build as failure
~~~

* example failure: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/68/console
* test build that removed everything: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_math4-install-pkg-xenial-amd64/66/consoleFull
update.title: add || true to docker clean statements in case there are no running containers or images

pull_request.title: add || true to docker clean statements in case there are no running containers or images

pullrequest.title: add || true to docker clean statements in case there are no running containers or images

content.raw: return always true can hide some other problems not strictly related to the lack of containers. An alternative implementation is in [#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/542](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/542)
content.html: return always true can hide some other problems not strictly related to the lack of containers. An alternative implementation is in #!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/542
